componenttext: Yes. So that's 17% growth in the quarter versus you had said RCA being 0. So the entirety of that is share gain?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. I think so. Now as we say every quarter, depending on which way these things go, regardless of which way they go, quarter-to-quarter swings in this data can move quite a bit from one quarter to another.
componenttext: Yes. I think so. Now as we say every quarter, depending on which way these things go, regardless of which way they go, quarter-to-quarter swings in this data can move quite a bit from one quarter to another.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: And is that an increase in headcount or recruiting or better productivity or a combination of the 2?
componenttext: And is that an increase in headcount or recruiting or better productivity or a combination of the 2?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Brad, this is Bob. It's both. We've had a lot of recruiting success. That's been a big initiative for us for the last 3 years. And we've talked about the fact that we've had -- a couple years ago was one of the best years in the history, if not the best y
componenttext: Brad, this is Bob. It's both. We've had a lot of recruiting success. That's been a big initiative for us for the last 3 years. And we've talked about the fact that we've had -- a couple years ago was one of the best years in the history, if not the best year in the history of our company. We repeated it last year. This year is on a similar pace, and we're starting to see the benefit of that recruiting. We are seeing better production from some of our people. We're teaming in some ways in doing some things. We've built in in-house investment banking capability to support our investment sales professionals. That's been helpful in a number of cases. And as a result, all of this came together to produce what you saw this quarter. I think it's notable, though, what Jim said, these things do fluctuate quarter-to-quarter. This was a particularly good quarter for us.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. That's helpful. And with the capital markets business, I know it's been something that we've been nervous on. I was hoping that you can give us some thoughts about how that business is shaping up looking forward. And also, whether you're starting to
componenttext: Okay. That's helpful. And with the capital markets business, I know it's been something that we've been nervous on. I was hoping that you can give us some thoughts about how that business is shaping up looking forward. And also, whether you're starting to see any sort of pullback in the credit markets.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Brad, this is Jim. We -- at the beginning of the year, as you know, we gave guidance that we thought the growth rate in this business would go back to high single digits. We think we -- obviously, the market -- we and the market have outperformed that pro
componenttext: Brad, this is Jim. We -- at the beginning of the year, as you know, we gave guidance that we thought the growth rate in this business would go back to high single digits. We think we -- obviously, the market -- we and the market have outperformed that projection. But we still believe that, that business will slow down and that that's coming and we may have just been a little bit early on that call. We think it'll slow down at a more sustainable level. But that continues to be our belief. This -- the rate of increase and liquidity in the market has come down. But as you know, there's still quite a bit of liquidity in the market.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. And I guess last one. Just sticking with capital markets with the commercial mortgage business. In the last quarter, you had said there was a $15 million headwind to EBITDA that you were expecting Q3, Q4 due to the GSE lending caps. And it certainly
componenttext: Okay. And I guess last one. Just sticking with capital markets with the commercial mortgage business. In the last quarter, you had said there was a $15 million headwind to EBITDA that you were expecting Q3, Q4 due to the GSE lending caps. And it certainly doesn't seem to have impacted the third quarter. So was wondering whether that was still the case. And if you were able to beat that, what would be driving it?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: That ended up being about flat for Q3. We are still projecting that Q4 will be down from prior year. We're now thinking plus or minus $10 million. But it's a little hard to project those numbers precisely. Other lenders have picked up pace. More capitals
componenttext: That ended up being about flat for Q3. We are still projecting that Q4 will be down from prior year. We're now thinking plus or minus $10 million. But it's a little hard to project those numbers precisely. Other lenders have picked up pace. More capitals come into market from other sources as they've pulled back.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Tony Paolone of JPMorgan.
componenttext: The next question is from Tony Paolone of JPMorgan.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: First, on GWS. I just wanted to reconcile if I think about the $237 million of revenue you got in September and annualize that it's like $2.8 billion, it just seems inside, if I recall right -- correctly the run rate revenues coming out of the deal. Is th
componenttext: First, on GWS. I just wanted to reconcile if I think about the $237 million of revenue you got in September and annualize that it's like $2.8 billion, it just seems inside, if I recall right -- correctly the run rate revenues coming out of the deal. Is there seasonality or can you just give us a sense as to what the annualized number should be as we look at GWS in the first year?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. We'll give a little more color. We normally do guidance in 90 days. But 2 comments. One is -- the numbers, I think, you may be referencing were from 2014. JCI have been shedding a couple of unprofitable contracts. And then, of course, revenue and exp
componenttext: Yes. We'll give a little more color. We normally do guidance in 90 days. But 2 comments. One is -- the numbers, I think, you may be referencing were from 2014. JCI have been shedding a couple of unprofitable contracts. And then, of course, revenue and expenses were impacted by foreign exchange since 2014.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. So we should have -- there will be some diminution in that just from a run rate point of view. That shouldn't be the number we look at.
componenttext: Okay. So we should have -- there will be some diminution in that just from a run rate point of view. That shouldn't be the number we look at.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: From a -- not EBITDA, but revenue, yes.
componenttext: From a -- not EBITDA, but revenue, yes.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: All right. In the accretion guide that you gave with the transaction, is that -- just trying to understand the connection, is that kind of still the EBITDA that you originally expected, I think, plus the cost saves and then minus, I guess, interest expens
componenttext: All right. In the accretion guide that you gave with the transaction, is that -- just trying to understand the connection, is that kind of still the EBITDA that you originally expected, I think, plus the cost saves and then minus, I guess, interest expense on the bond deal you did and then some D&A? Is that how you're getting to that accretion? Just trying to understand the components of that number.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. Pretty much. I think you've outlined the right factors.
componenttext: Yes. Pretty much. I think you've outlined the right factors.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: And what was it that, I guess, surprised you or turned out to be a bit more positive to move from mid-single-digit to high single-digit accretion?
componenttext: And what was it that, I guess, surprised you or turned out to be a bit more positive to move from mid-single-digit to high single-digit accretion?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: There's 2 factors. One being increased synergy and the second just increased confidence.
componenttext: There's 2 factors. One being increased synergy and the second just increased confidence.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. And the synergy, I think you had mentioned $30 million, but I thought that was the same as what it was originally and the extra $20 million was something for 2017.
componenttext: Okay. And the synergy, I think you had mentioned $30 million, but I thought that was the same as what it was originally and the extra $20 million was something for 2017.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: No. When we first announced the deal in March, we referenced the $35 million run rate synergy and noted that we expected most of that to be back-end weighted to the second year -- not most of it but for it to be more back-end weighted so that we'd realize
componenttext: No. When we first announced the deal in March, we referenced the $35 million run rate synergy and noted that we expected most of that to be back-end weighted to the second year -- not most of it but for it to be more back-end weighted so that we'd realize that over 2 years. That $35 million run-rate synergy has now increased to $50 million. And we're saying we believe we'll achieve $30 million of that $50 million in the next calendar year in 2016. And by the end of '17, we should largely achieve the full $50 million run rate synergy. So the total amount of synergy has increased, and the pace in which we expect to achieve the synergy has increased.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. Got it. And then I have a question in Development Services and I guess as well as Investment Management. Given the -- how robust capital markets are, do you think you'll accelerate asset sales and drive, promote incentive fees and that sort of stuff
componenttext: Okay. Got it. And then I have a question in Development Services and I guess as well as Investment Management. Given the -- how robust capital markets are, do you think you'll accelerate asset sales and drive, promote incentive fees and that sort of stuff in the next few quarters? I noticed that it seemed like your carried interest was a little higher this quarter. I'm just curious as to what your plans are with again, the development pipeline being pretty large and moving its way through and then any other asset sales that might drive promotes.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. Tony, you mentioned both the development business and the Investment Management business. And it has been the case for some time now and continues to be case that we're aggressively harvesting assets in our Investment Management business because that
componenttext: Yes. Tony, you mentioned both the development business and the Investment Management business. And it has been the case for some time now and continues to be case that we're aggressively harvesting assets in our Investment Management business because that's what our clients want us to do. We're able to fetch good prices and recycle the capital for them in many cases. And they're -- and generating very good relative returns. And so we'll continue down that path. In the development business, we built up a very healthy in-process portfolio of opportunities. They're very well underwritten, very good and we think that, that business will contribute really nicely to the company fourth quarter this year and next year. And we're not doing anything to accelerate it. Development projects have their own life cycle. And you have to get them approved, designed, built and leased up and then you can sell them. So we're not doing anything to accelerate that process. But that process is playing out. And as you know, we've -- our portfolio of projects has grown nicely over the last couple of years. So we expect to see some good returns as a result.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. Can you share what the fourth quarter expected incentive fees or carried interest amount is going to be?
componenttext: Okay. Can you share what the fourth quarter expected incentive fees or carried interest amount is going to be?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Tony, what we mentioned on our -- just before we opened up for questions, is that we expect the combination of the 2 businesses to be up moderately over last year.
componenttext: Tony, what we mentioned on our -- just before we opened up for questions, is that we expect the combination of the 2 businesses to be up moderately over last year.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just last question. If I think about your various business lines and then also your various geographies and then overlay that with some of the more macroeconomic volatility we've seen over the last few months, where do you guys see pressure
componenttext: Okay. And then just last question. If I think about your various business lines and then also your various geographies and then overlay that with some of the more macroeconomic volatility we've seen over the last few months, where do you guys see pressure, if anywhere on that matrix?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Right now, Tony, we're not seeing a lot of pressure. I would tell you where we're seeing the strongest growth is in Europe. You saw the results this quarter. We expect that to continue. But we saw good growth in places where people didn't necessarily expe
componenttext: Right now, Tony, we're not seeing a lot of pressure. I would tell you where we're seeing the strongest growth is in Europe. You saw the results this quarter. We expect that to continue. But we saw good growth in places where people didn't necessarily expect it. In Greater China, we had nice growth. In Australia, we did. And so we haven't felt a lot of meaningful pressure at this point. And the backlogs and business we have suggest that the year should finish out nicely for us.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Brandon Dobell of William Blair.
componenttext: The next question is from Brandon Dobell of William Blair.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Let me keep hammering the capital markets line for a second here. Do you feel there's any -- or was any acceleration in deals and this with an eye of maybe uncertainty towards the end of year, are people just kind of changing their approach based on how t
componenttext: Let me keep hammering the capital markets line for a second here. Do you feel there's any -- or was any acceleration in deals and this with an eye of maybe uncertainty towards the end of year, are people just kind of changing their approach based on how the interest rate noise is kind of playing to the capital markets? Are people changing their trajectory, or was it just it felt like deals that closed are -- were closing when they were supposed to close?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Brandon, this is Jim. We didn't -- I don't think -- we did not see any change in the dynamics of people trying to accelerate deal closings. I would say that you asked about coming forward next quarter. I mean next -- Q4 of the last 2 years has been really
componenttext: Brandon, this is Jim. We didn't -- I don't think -- we did not see any change in the dynamics of people trying to accelerate deal closings. I would say that you asked about coming forward next quarter. I mean next -- Q4 of the last 2 years has been really strong, so it's a little bit of a tough compare. But outside of that, I think the business activity will still be strong.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. And within the U.S., looking at the larger markets versus secondary markets, I know there's still some pretty big gaps in the cap rates and things like that between those markets. But do you look at those, if you want to divide the market in those 2
componenttext: Okay. And within the U.S., looking at the larger markets versus secondary markets, I know there's still some pretty big gaps in the cap rates and things like that between those markets. But do you look at those, if you want to divide the market in those 2 categories, where do you feel you've got more momentum or where do you feel the momentum is sustainable over a longer duration for your brokers?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Well, there's still, honestly, an awful lot of activity across the market globally, both in this key core CBD markets and in the secondary markets. But we have seen strengthening in the secondary markets, both throughout the U.S. and EMEA.
componenttext: Well, there's still, honestly, an awful lot of activity across the market globally, both in this key core CBD markets and in the secondary markets. But we have seen strengthening in the secondary markets, both throughout the U.S. and EMEA.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then in GWS, maybe some color on how the cadence of the either contract renewals or your opportunity to kind of get under the covers of some of these contracts, how we should think about that impacting some of the potential knock-on revenues aro
componenttext: Okay. And then in GWS, maybe some color on how the cadence of the either contract renewals or your opportunity to kind of get under the covers of some of these contracts, how we should think about that impacting some of the potential knock-on revenues around other services, whether it be add-ons to the existing contracts for facility or property, leasing. Maybe it's some capital markets activity, but I guess I'd focus kind of more on leasing and consulting around existing contracts. Is it going to take you 4, 5, 6 years to get through all these things? Or do you have opportunities to go back or to go into one of those customers kind of midstream and change what those deals might look like?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Well, Brandon, we always have the opportunity because of the full-service nature of what we do to talk to those, and they're mostly large corporates. Though, increasingly, we're doing work for hospital systems and government enterprises. But the -- we alw
componenttext: Well, Brandon, we always have the opportunity because of the full-service nature of what we do to talk to those, and they're mostly large corporates. Though, increasingly, we're doing work for hospital systems and government enterprises. But the -- we always have the opportunity to talk to them on a full-service basis. But we've made an absolute commitment to ourselves and to our clients that for the time being, our focus for them with this acquisition, which again, as we talked about in our prepared remarks, is the biggest we've done in a decade, and really unlike anything we spend in our sector. The focus is on great results for our clients. We believe that the other things we do aren't going to be a secret to them. And that over time, [indiscernible] provide great service to them with the work we do now. We'll begin -- we'll be able to integrate back and forth between the client base that we have and the client base that GWS brought to us with the very complementary services we've had. But that's not what we've talked about in our underwriting or -- and Jim's talked a number of times over the last couple of quarters about what we expect out of this deal. What we're talking about is not that. That will be there if we do a good job. Our focus is on doing a good job. We think there will be upside, but we aren't factoring in a lot of revenue synergy into that business right now. We're factoring in our normal growth and excellent execution. And we think the revenue synergy will come as a result of that.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. Does the acquisition change how we should think about the headcount growth trajectory for '16 i.e., do you need to add service professionals in the core service lines kind of around the GWS deal to really take advantage of the breadth of the portfol
componenttext: Okay. Does the acquisition change how we should think about the headcount growth trajectory for '16 i.e., do you need to add service professionals in the core service lines kind of around the GWS deal to really take advantage of the breadth of the portfolio? Or should we expect kind of the numbers of headcount you guys had in '16 to look like it did in '15 so the growth rate is a little bit slower?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes, we won't need to add a lot of professionals. We added a lot of professionals, as you know, and really kind of at a record pace the last couple of years in our transactional businesses. And we worked for 80%, 90% of the large companies around the worl
componenttext: Yes, we won't need to add a lot of professionals. We added a lot of professionals, as you know, and really kind of at a record pace the last couple of years in our transactional businesses. And we worked for 80%, 90% of the large companies around the world on the transaction side already. We're positioned to do more for those clients. We're positioned to do work for them on a contractual basis and we're seeing more of that. But we're not going to have to meaningfully ramp up our headcount to get that done.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: [Operator Instructions] The next question is from Mitch Germain with JMP Securities.
componenttext: [Operator Instructions] The next question is from Mitch Germain with JMP Securities.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Jim, I was trying to get a better idea with regards to the guidance bump. It looks like $0.03 to $0.04 of it was GWS, mortgage, some carried interest. Is that the way to kind of thing about the different variables that led you guys to take such a construc
componenttext: Jim, I was trying to get a better idea with regards to the guidance bump. It looks like $0.03 to $0.04 of it was GWS, mortgage, some carried interest. Is that the way to kind of thing about the different variables that led you guys to take such a constructive view on the outlook?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: I would say those are factors. But really, the businesses have been performing pretty strongly across all 3 regions in all lines of business. We do a bottoms-up detailed review every quarter, and it was that review that took us to this increase.
componenttext: I would say those are factors. But really, the businesses have been performing pretty strongly across all 3 regions in all lines of business. We do a bottoms-up detailed review every quarter, and it was that review that took us to this increase.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Great. And if I look at the balance sheet a little over 2x debt-to-EBITDA today, where do you see that factoring out as 2016 progresses? Do you see that dropping down to more normalized levels?
componenttext: Great. And if I look at the balance sheet a little over 2x debt-to-EBITDA today, where do you see that factoring out as 2016 progresses? Do you see that dropping down to more normalized levels?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: When we announced the deal in March, we said we thought we would be at 1.7x leverage, 1.7x EBITDA by year end. And I think we are right on track for that. The -- that's -- even that's a relatively conservative view. So our bank covenants will show a lower
componenttext: When we announced the deal in March, we said we thought we would be at 1.7x leverage, 1.7x EBITDA by year end. And I think we are right on track for that. The -- that's -- even that's a relatively conservative view. So our bank covenants will show a lower leverage ratio because we can pro forma in the run-rate EBITDA that we've acquired, et cetera. But on the most conservative view, we're just over 2 now and we'll be under 2 by year end.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Great. And then just 2 quick ones, 2 more quick ones for me. One, in terms of retention GWS. It sounds like you said you guys have the business leaders in place and the management in place. How did you guys -- do you see any loss in terms of some of the k
componenttext: Great. And then just 2 quick ones, 2 more quick ones for me. One, in terms of retention GWS. It sounds like you said you guys have the business leaders in place and the management in place. How did you guys -- do you see any loss in terms of some of the key personnel that you guys were expecting to take on?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Well, the most important people have signed employment agreements 4, 5 years and are showing quite significant enthusiasm for the business from the combination. So I don't think so. We will have -- there will be some overlap. So there will be some people
componenttext: Well, the most important people have signed employment agreements 4, 5 years and are showing quite significant enthusiasm for the business from the combination. So I don't think so. We will have -- there will be some overlap. So there will be some people that leave. But I think we're in a very strong shape there as far as retention.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Great. And now that this deal has been completed, are you seeing -- are you guys going to be now focusing back on some of the smaller tuck-in and strategic acquisitions?
componenttext: Great. And now that this deal has been completed, are you seeing -- are you guys going to be now focusing back on some of the smaller tuck-in and strategic acquisitions?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. I think you'll start to see it pick up probably as early as our next quarterly call.
componenttext: Yes. I think you'll start to see it pick up probably as early as our next quarterly call.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: The next question is from David Ridley-Lane of Bank of America.
componenttext: The next question is from David Ridley-Lane of Bank of America.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: So one concern we've heard from investors is that sources of cross-border capital either commodity-driven economies or greater Asia economies are likely to slow going forward. What have you seen, either quantitatively or anecdotally, about cross-border ca
componenttext: So one concern we've heard from investors is that sources of cross-border capital either commodity-driven economies or greater Asia economies are likely to slow going forward. What have you seen, either quantitatively or anecdotally, about cross-border capital flows?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: We have not seen that, David. What we've seen is that cross-border capital flows have remained strong. We've interviewed, kind of polled our clients in various ways. We think half of the clients that we did business with a year ago that were moving capita
componenttext: We have not seen that, David. What we've seen is that cross-border capital flows have remained strong. We've interviewed, kind of polled our clients in various ways. We think half of the clients that we did business with a year ago that were moving capital across borders, half of them intend to move more capital this year than they did a year ago. And so you saw the numbers for the -- numbers not only for us, but for the whole market for the quarter and the year. So we have not seen a pullback in that at this point. It just hasn't been something we've seen. And in Europe, in particular, we've seen a meaningful increase in cross-border flows into Europe.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Got it. And then on the capital markets pipeline, has the sort of disruption we've seen in sort of the debt markets and around CMBS in particular, has that been enough to put some deals out of the pipeline? Or has most of things that you've been working o
componenttext: Got it. And then on the capital markets pipeline, has the sort of disruption we've seen in sort of the debt markets and around CMBS in particular, has that been enough to put some deals out of the pipeline? Or has most of things that you've been working on still very much go ahead for the fourth quarter?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: From what we've seen, there's sufficient capital from other sources to step in. So again, as I mentioned earlier, we have been anticipating that the rate of growth in sales will come down to a more sustainable level. And we still believe that that's likel
componenttext: From what we've seen, there's sufficient capital from other sources to step in. So again, as I mentioned earlier, we have been anticipating that the rate of growth in sales will come down to a more sustainable level. And we still believe that that's likely to be the case. But we're not seeing deals die basically because of the lack of debt capital.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: Got it. And then just kind of curious. On the leasing volumes, do you -- did you see any impact from the market volatility? Or were corporations pretty -- had enough confidence to go ahead and execute leases even with some of the broader market volatility
componenttext: Got it. And then just kind of curious. On the leasing volumes, do you -- did you see any impact from the market volatility? Or were corporations pretty -- had enough confidence to go ahead and execute leases even with some of the broader market volatility in the quarter?

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: We saw strong growth in leasing around the world, slightly slower growth in the U.S. this quarter than we've seen, but still very strong at 9%. And so we haven't seen the dynamic. We're expecting to see some of that in China, but we really haven't, as of
componenttext: We saw strong growth in leasing around the world, slightly slower growth in the U.S. this quarter than we've seen, but still very strong at 9%. And so we haven't seen the dynamic. We're expecting to see some of that in China, but we really haven't, as of now, haven't seen that pullback. And we're expecting to see a nice finish to the year. We are watching China like everybody else.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: The next question is from Mitch Germain of JMP Securities.
componenttext: The next question is from Mitch Germain of JMP Securities.

componenttext: I'm sorry, guys, just one more for me. How should I look at the recurring -- the fee revenue of the company on a more -- on a pro forma level when we assume like a full year impact of the GWS deal?

componenttext: Mitch, we're not -- we haven't had any...

componenttext: [indiscernible] percentage of the whole.

componenttext: Yes. We haven't given any guidance on that. When we come back next quarter, we'll take a look at that and maybe we can give some more color.

headline: CBRE Group, Inc., Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 27, 2015
componenttextpreview: We have no further questions at this time. I would like to turn the conference back to management for any closing comments.
componenttext: We have no further questions at this time. I would like to turn the conference back to management for any closing comments.
